Name: Amulet
Description: A basalt heart amulet, finely worked and pierced for suspension. The Egyptians believed the heart to be the seat of intelligence and actions, as it also held memory it was weighed at the moment of judgement. The heart was the only organ to remain in the body during mummification. This and the other three hearts (1967.60.32q, r & s) found on the body were originally strung together but only a fragment of the thread survived.
